programmes.show_name: The Repair Shop on the Road
programmes.show_description: Will and Dom learn how a devastating fire put a 5,000-year-old craft in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Chris Shaw repairs a Gaelic pipe music book, and Dom has the chance to make his own sporran.
3/10. Paramedics help a woman who has been thrown off a horse near Dunbar. Meanwhile, the air ambulance brings a child with appendicitis from Campbeltown to Glasgow.
Sitcom. Jack and Victor become dogsitters, and Winston's jealousy sparks some serious pet one-upmanship. Isa prepares for the Craiglang Community Bake Off. Contains adult humour.
1/5. Scotland's favourite force are back battling bams and busting scams. The Chief deals with speculation he might quit his tartan patch to become head of the London Met.
2/8. Christine opens up to Sophie about dating with autism. Contains some strong language and adult humour.
Gary Robertson brings you all the main issues from the world of politics and beyond. Big interviews, discussion and analysis of the stories that matter to Scotland.

1/12. Lucy and Adam's big move to their dream farm in Scotland hangs in the balance.
3/6. Banjo and his team travel to Skye to transform a dated caf√© and bookshop. Will Banjo's decision to spend almost the whole budget on a huge stained-glass window pay off?
4/6. Banjo redesigns a castle turret room and a bedroom at a lighthouse.
Highlights from the BBC Scotland channel.
More from the day's top stories and communities across Scotland.
Pink Dreams follows grandmother Lorraine as she performs her tribute act to a megastar 20 years younger, Pink.
3/8. Wedding supervisor Amanda makes sure everything is perfect for the couple's big day, former taxi driver Ken juggles several jobs, and head chef James can't stay away from the action.
4/8. Manager Steven has to deal with a pungent problem at the Fife caravan park.
5/6. The Isle of Mull Rugby Club hire Banjo to redesign their bar. But with little knowledge of the game, how will Banjo's adventurous design go down with the club?
6/6. To launch a new spirit distilled on the cheese farm where he lives, Banjo is asked to design a rustic gin tasting bar, using salvaged materials found on the farm.
Tyler's business pitch to Harry doesn't go as planned, leading him to let his frustrations out on an unwitting Drew. Meanwhile, Roisin's stress increases as Tommy's patience wears thin.
3/6. Beth's hopes of a traditional Sunday lunch collapse when Cathy and Colin arrive arguing. Contains some strong language and adult humour.
Conversation about Scotland's biggest news stories, hosted by Martin Geissler.
4/6. For the first time ever, Limmy's Show goes live with sketches and stunts! Contains some strong language and adult humour.
